metadata.purpose: The Onboarding process serves to establish and maintain systematic communication with new BizBanking customers from their initial sign-in through the first 180 days of the banking relationship. The primary objectives are: (1) Activation - Ensure customers activate their accounts and understand available banking services through welcome communications, demo videos, and pre-approved offers. (2) Engagement - Maintain continuous touchpoints via multiple channels (SMS, email, phone, branch, social media) to build relationship depth and prevent early attrition. (3) Education - Guide customers through bank processes and available products through structured communication at key milestones.
metadata.trigger: The Onboarding process is triggered when a new BizBanking customer completes their initial Sign In to the banking platform. This is the Day 1 event that initiates the 180-day onboarding journey. The sign-in event indicates that account opening has been completed, customer credentials have been provisioned, and the customer is ready to begin their banking relationship.
metadata.frequency: The Onboarding process runs continuously - each new BizBanking customer sign-in initiates an individual 180-day onboarding journey. Multiple customer journeys run in parallel at any given time. The process follows a structured cadence: Activation (Day 1-2) with multiple simultaneous touchpoints, Early Engagement (Day 5-14) with 2-3 touchpoints, Mid-Journey (Day 30-60) with 3-4 touchpoints, Late Journey (Day 60-90) with 2 touchpoints, and Close-Out (Day 180) with final follow-up.
metadata.volume: Per Customer Journey: 10-15 touchpoints across 180 days, multiple channels engaged (SMS, email, phone, branch, social media), estimated 5-7 system interactions per customer. Operational volume metrics (new customer sign-ins per month, concurrent onboarding journeys, total communications sent) to be confirmed with SME input.

imported_data.description: Customer onboarding process for bank managers to continue communications with new customers

process_steps.name: Customer Sign In
process_steps.description: New BizBanking customer completes initial sign-in to banking platform, triggering onboarding journey

process_steps.name: Activation Communications
process_steps.description: Send Day 2 communications: Mobile SMS, email campaigns, pre-approved offers

process_steps.name: Welcome Content Delivery
process_steps.description: Deliver demo video, presentation of bank process, introductory video, welcome email

process_steps.name: Bank Check-In Call
process_steps.description: Day 7-30 check-in call and Day 14 email, targeted digital campaign

process_steps.name: Activation Notifications
process_steps.description: Day 30 and Day 45 activation notifications, branch engagement call

process_steps.name: Feedback Collection
process_steps.description: Day 60-90 call centre feedback and engagement call, social media campaign

process_steps.name: Final Follow-Up
process_steps.description: Day 180 call centre follow-up - process conclusion
process_steps.rationale: Close onboarding journey, transition to BAU

process_exceptions.name: KYC Check Defence Industry
process_exceptions.description: During the activation phase (Day 2), if the KYC (Know Your Customer) check identifies that the customer operates in the defence industry, the standard onboarding flow is terminated. A decline email is sent to the customer, and the onboarding journey does not proceed further.
process_exceptions.trigger: KYC check identifies customer is in defence industry

gaps.name: Missing Desktop Procedure (DTP)
gaps.description: The Onboarding process does not have a documented Desktop Procedure. No step-by-step operational guide exists for staff executing the process.
gaps.impact: Staff lack standardised reference for process execution; new team members lack reference document; process consistency may vary
gaps.recommendation: Create a DTP document covering day-by-day activities, system navigation, and decision points for the 180-day onboarding journey.

controls.name: KYC Defence Industry Screening
controls.description: This preventive control screens new BizBanking customers during the activation phase to identify those operating in the defence industry. When detected, the control prevents onboarding from proceeding by terminating the journey and sending a decline notification.
controls.how_performed: Automated KYC screening checks customer industry classification against restricted industries list; defence industry triggers process termination and decline email

controls.name: Customer Identity Verification (CDD)
controls.description: Verifies customer identity documents and information before account activation proceeds. Core CDD requirement under AML regulations.
controls.how_performed: Automated document verification via KYC Screening System; ID documents matched against customer-provided information

controls.name: Beneficial Ownership Identification
controls.description: Identifies and verifies beneficial owners (>25% ownership) for corporate/business customers. Required for legal persons and arrangements.
controls.how_performed: Semi-automated - system prompts for BO information; manual review for complex ownership structures

controls.name: PEP Screening
controls.description: Screens customers and beneficial owners against Politically Exposed Persons databases. Triggers enhanced due diligence when matches found.
controls.how_performed: Automated screening against global PEP databases; manual escalation for positive matches

controls.name: High-Risk Country Screening
controls.description: Screens customers with connections to high-risk third countries (per EU/FATF lists). Triggers enhanced due diligence requirements.
controls.how_performed: Automated country risk screening based on customer nationality, residence, and business operations

controls.name: Data Processing Consent Capture
controls.description: Captures explicit, informed consent for personal data processing at customer sign-in. Ensures lawful basis for data processing under GDPR.
controls.how_performed: Automated consent capture integrated into digital sign-in flow; granular consent options presented

controls.name: Communication Opt-In Verification
controls.description: Verifies customer has provided consent before sending marketing/promotional communications. Checks opt-in status before each communication.
controls.how_performed: Automated check in Email Marketing Platform against consent database before campaign dispatch

controls.name: Customer Data Retention Compliance
controls.description: Ensures customer data is retained per regulatory requirements (5 years for AML) while respecting GDPR data minimisation principles.
controls.how_performed: Manual review at journey close-out to ensure retention policies applied; data categorised for appropriate retention periods

systems.name: SMS Gateway
systems.description: Send mobile SMS communications to customers

systems.name: Email Marketing Platform
systems.description: Manage email campaigns, welcome emails, targeted campaigns

systems.name: Call Centre System
systems.description: Manage customer calls, check-ins, feedback collection

regulations.name: AMLD 5 (5th Anti-Money Laundering Directive)
specific_requirements: Enhanced CDD for high-risk third countries
